timeline.body:
might be a good idea to keep `_traversal` here and in line 249 below as a referenced constant.
Seems to imply assumption of convention used in multiple places as a "magic string". In which case, changing in 1 place will break overall & dependent functions.
Also referenced [here](https://github.com/JanusGraph/janusgraph/blob/ac20052335506012e9b721b9897fef4b6100026e/janusgraph-core/src/main/java/org/janusgraph/graphdb/management/JanusGraphManager.java#L267) in the master branch.

timeline.bodyHTML:
As I understand, we should remove null bindings for the key as well. Thus, I don't think we need if (bindings.get(key) != null).
I.e. instead of:

if (bindings.get(key) != null) {
    gremlinExecutor.getScriptEngineManager().getBindings().remove(key);
}

We need just:

bindings.remove(key);

Correct me if I'm wrong here
timeline.author: porunov

replies.bodyText:
Bindings.get(key) == null  is ambiguous. From the docs:

[...] if this map contains a mapping from a key k to a value v such that (key==null ? k==null : key.equals(k)), then this method returns v; otherwise it returns null.

Therefore !=null means that the binding contains a key which is also not null. However, I did not research how a null entry in a Binding arises and which meaning it has in the context of the GremlinExecutor and therefore I'm not sure if such an entry should remain here or not. But from my naive understanding, @porunov is right here.
